page.title: 06INDUSTRY PAST, GRAINTHORPE.
page.content: Even prior to the Conquest,{salting} was extremely important,in this area.The survey refers to 23 Salterns at Grainthorpe and Marshchapel and records show salt rent was still being collected in the early 1600's. The salt industry appears to have disappeared when sea banks were raised to reclaim new land for pasture. The visible remains,to the east of the main road, are very conspicuous as low mounds. The salt route from Grainthorpe was from Beacon Hill in Wragholme via Salters' Lane, to Salters' Hill, to Ludford, and on via Saltergate to Lincoln and then onto Newark. Another chief feature was{ {Grainthorpes' port, Swineshaven {Harbour,}now silted up since the sea retreated: needed 2 custom's officers and exported huge quantities of wool.
